page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW OF BLOCK
page.content: This 12 sq.km block is being shared with another school.The information gathered here is of the six squares in the eastern half of the block. The six sq.km contain the village of Blackwell and Burcot and part of the village of Finstall,all in the Bromsgrove District,Worcestershire. The area is predominately a farming one,with some housing,mainly of the larger type.The main Birmingham to Burcot railway line runs through and contained within the block is the Lickey Incline said to be the steepest railway slope in England. In addition to a private golf course are two sites owned by the scouting movement,one for camping and one for water sports. Birmingham Council own some properties in Blackwell:residential education and assessment centres.
